item.title: Connecting Windows VMs to Mac-Hosted APIs
item.description: When developing distributed applications, it‚Äôs common to run different components on separate environments. A frequent scenario is hosting backend APIs on a macOS machine while consuming them from a Windows-based client application running inside a virtual machine VM. This setup works well with tools like Parallels Desktop or VMware Fusion, but requires a bit of networking and certificate setup.

item.title: Cocona - Clean console apps in .NET
item.description: Coconahttps://github. com/amybarga/cocona is a small framework that simplifies building command line applications in . NET. It handles parsing, help pages, dependency injection and more, so you can focus on your app's logic. It makes it easy to build well-structured vertically sliced commands.

item.title: .NET MAUI setup on macOS ‚Äî build once, run everywhere

item.title: OpenAI Chat Model Cheat Sheet - Decoding the Chaos
item.description: OpenAI‚Äôs model names e. g., o4, 4o are confusing and change often. This guide is my quick reference for picking the best model for any task.

item.title: RAID - Rapid AI Development
item.description: Normally, when building things, we need to balance quality and speed. You could spend all day polishing and optimizing a single feature, or you could call it ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù and move on to the next thing. When developers decide something is good enough but want to improve it later, we call this ‚Äútechnical debt‚Äù and record it in the backlog for another time.

item.title: üö¶ Loading Guards in Blazor - Stop Writing Null-Checks Everywhere
item.description: When building UI with Blazor, every data-fetching async call leaves you sprinkling if data == null or if IsLoaded around the page. It bloats markup, hides the real UI, and is easy to forget in a big component tree.

item.title: The Right Mobile App Framework - Comprehensive Decision Tree
item.description: A colleague recently introduced me to Expohttps://expo. dev. I read a bit about it and realized it was just another React Native wrapper.
